snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s delay in expanding the law, which he had promised to do by the end of February, is more perplexing considering his determination to improve the lives of struggling New Yorkers.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column questions what happened to New York Mayor Bill de Blasio's vow to issue an executive order to expand the city's living wage law; contends his commitment to improve the lives of struggling New Yorkers makes his decision to delay even more confusing; offers some explanations de Blasio might use.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s delay in expanding the law, which he had promised to do by the end of February, is more perplexing considering his determination to improve the lives of struggling New Yorkers.

headline.main: Silence From de Blasio on Expansion of Living Wage Law
headline.print_headline: Perplexing Silence From de Blasio on Expansion of Living Wage Law
